history.content: I wouldn't worry about it. Quite a few people drop 170, and they have enough resources and TAs to accomodate anyone who wants to take it. I haven't heard of anyone who wanted to take the class who couldn't get in by the add deadline. The instructors usually increase the class size when the semester starts.

I wouldn't worry about it. Quite a few people drop 170, and they have enough resources and TAs to accomodate anyone who wants to take it. I haven't heard of anyone who wanted to take the class who couldn't get in by the add deadline.

Keep in mind that budget constraints change each semester so there is no guaranteed number of sections for a class. Suffice to say, instructors do their best to accommodate as many students as possible.

Regarding the wait list - yes, there is usually a large bump when the adjustment period starts because the reserve requirements come down & seats are made available to anyone on the wait list, regardless of major.

A good rule of thumb is that appx 10% of total enrollment will drop the class so if you are within that window on the wait list, then you have a good chance of getting in. That said, there are no guarantees and you should ALWAYS have a plan B just in case it doesn't work out.

Adjustment period started recently and I noticed a huge bump in my waitlist position, from almost 400 to upper 80s. However it’s stalled out in the 80s the past couple days, even though (according to BerkeleyTime) there’s only 683/700 enrolled right now.

I was undeclared last semester (just declared) so I (and everyone else) should be able to enroll, given enough space.

Last semester 170 had 884 students among 27 sections. This semester there are 24 sections which means it should accommodate around 780-800 people, more than enough for me given my waitlist position. Yet my position hasn’t changed much.

Should I be worried at all about getting in?
history.subject: 170 waitlist?
